comments:
I have a test case that does the following:

	public void testApplicationStartup() {
		PerformanceMeter meter =
Performance.getDefault().createPerformanceMeter(getClass().getName() +
".testPerformance");
		try {
			meter.stop();
			meter.commit();
			Performance.getDefault().assertPerformanceInRelativeBand(meter,
Dimension.ELAPSED_PROCESS, -50, 5);
		} finally {
			meter.dispose();
		}
	}

PerformanceMeter.commit is causing the exception below. I checked the type of
the elementsin the set, and they are all Dim instances, instead of String as
assumed by Sample.getPropertyKeys.

Oops, that problem slipped through because on MacOS X no items were added to the Property data 
structure. Sorry about that. I've commented out the culprit and released to HEAD.
Has been fixed some time ago...
